Design-ul Inteligent te lasa sa faci UI care mege pe Device-uri de toata formele si marimile, de la un mic telefon mobil pana la un Monitor Gigantic. Desing-ul inteligent este in special important pentru produse care atrag consumatorul si care sunt folosite acasa si la servici, si pe drum.
Accessibility allows users with disability, especially those with visual impairment, to use your product. Accessibility  is always important, but especially for software that are a daily necessity.

Typography is a key part of UI design, and can greatly affect the attractiveness and usability of your product. It is especially important for software that rely on look and feel to attract customers.
User tutorials can guide users in using your product effectively. Help and documentation is an effective way of training advanced users in complex software.

Reducing the memory requirements of your product allows more users to be able to use your software. Heavy-weight software that require a lot of computer resources benefit from this kind of optimization.
Being able to use software without internet connectivity is always a good option, but in some cases is indispensable. Productivity tools, for example, are a good candidate for this upgrade.

By improving error handling and logging in your features, not only do you make it easier to support and debug your features, you improve the way users feel about the quality of your software. Improved error handling is always a good investment!

Being able to upgrade to new versions of your software without hitches creates a great user experience. This becomes invaluable for software where the user is creating a lot of data (such as documents) which need to be migrated to later versions of your software.
API-urile lasa alti dezvoltatori sa-ti extinda programele si sa le integreze cu el. Programele indrepdate spre data sunt deobicei buni candidati pentru furnizarea unui API.
Adaptive UI is the ability for your features to adapt and adjust to each user, based on their usage. This can be a powerful tool for products that are used very frequently throughout the day.
Gestures give users the ability to quickly navigate you software using touch gestures. Mobile/touch centric software benefit the most from this upgrade.
Localizarea este procesul de traducere si facandu-ti programul adecvat pentru audiente non-Engleze. Programele cu text centrat beneficiaza cel mai mult de acest upgrade.

First things first: let's head over to the backlog and figure out what we should work on.
The backlog is where you pick the tasks and features to work on in the next sprint (1 week of work).
Let's begin with desiging a new feature. Click the feature button on the left.
Besides features there are other tasks we need to focus on.
In the backlog on the left, double click the 'Infrastructure' task to add it to the next sprint.
Hover the mouse over the question mark that appears above the task, to see what it's for and what it will unlock when it's leveled up.
We are ready to start the sprint! Click the big play button at the top of the screen to get going.
Your team is your most valuable asset. Hire capable people with good attitudes, and you are well on your way to success!
Many different factors can cause your employees to become dissatisfied.
There are three ways you can deal with an unhappy employee: Increase their salary, add more goodies to the office, or make them or others that may be affecting them redundant.

That's a great little one-person show you got going on there, but if you you're going to succeed you have to start building a team. Start looking at candidates and hire someone that complements your skillset.
Getting the right investors on-board can be the difference between fizzling out, or having enough runway to become profitable.
Investors appear here when you level up the Seek Investor task in your backlog.
You can select up to two investors to pitch your startup to. Pitching to investors can be tricky business, so if it's your first time remember to do a practice run.
You pitch your startup to investors with a slide show. There are 12 different subjects you can choose from.
Remember not all investors are interested in all subjects. Use their profile for clues as to what they might be interested in
You can also ask investors a question, which helps you eliminate some subjects they might not be interested in
If an investor reaches a minimum level of interest, they will make you an offer. You'll then have the chance to negotiate and/or accept the offer
Our cash reserves are slowly running out! We should look into finding some investors.
Awesome, you just built your very first feature! Now look at what else we need to do to complete the Minimum Viable Product, by clicking the arrow key at the bottom of the screen.
Fantastic, you just leveled up your very first backlog item! Now look at what else we need to do to complete the Minimum Viable Product, by clicking the arrow key at the bottom of the screen.
Great, you have gained some experience in marketing! We should start spending some money on marketing activities.
This is the total number of functional features. Increasing feature count improves the rate of signups.

This is the sum of all feature ratings. Improving feature rating will reduce customer churn. A feature's rating depends on its component count, upgrades, performance, design/tech balance, and bug count.
The percentage of feature components that are secured. Increasing security reduces the chances of security attacks being successful.
The percentage of technical feature components that are covered by a test. Tests reduce the number of bugs that may surface in a component.
Market research can sometimes identify features that are in high demand by customers. Building these features might be complex but can be well worth your while!
Building each requested feature will boost signups and reduce churn.
Market research is crucial part of any startup. To understand what features to build for your customers, level up Market Research in your backlog.
Tasks and features may take more than one sprint to finish. You can see their progress in the little bars at the top of the screen.
Continue to run sprints until the current tasks are completed.
Feature upgrades are extremely important in making effective and desirable. Here you can research upgrades that can then be added to individual features.
Remember upgrades take a long time to research. The best upgrades depend on the industry and type of product you're building, so choose wisely!
Feature rating is based on its number of components, design/tech balance, upgrades, performance, and number of bugs. Requested features also have an increased rating.
{{He}} is always buying and playing with the latest devices and gadgets.
{{He}} always installs latest beta release of the OS on {{his}} phone.
Whenever updating an app on {{his}} phone, {{he}} reads all of the release notes.
{{He}} used to build electronic kits as a kid.
{{He}} is the president of the local Lego club.
Growing up, {{he}} enjoyed assembling computer parts.
{{He}} are mare increde in internetul 5G ca va fi inlocuit cu fibra.
{{He}} stie destul de putin despre racirea pe lichid pentru calculatoare.
{{He}} has recently invested in a submarine data center startup.
{{He}} has a tape placed over {{his}} phone camera.
{{He}} este un mare fan al filmului original Tron.
{{He}} n-a vrut sa ne foloseasca reteaua Wi-Fi si foloseste telefonul {{his}} ca sa faca hotspot.
{{He}} always pays for {{his}} food with cash.
{{He}} adora tatuajele si are mai multe.
{{He}} doar detine monitoare 4K si injura la ele.
{{He}} detine o tableta de desenat foarte scumpa.
{{He}} is a great believer that skeuomorphism will make a comeback, albeit in a different form.
{{He}} uraste siteurile care deturneaza rotita mouseului cu javascript.
{{He}} este foarte bine imbracat(a) si prezentat(a).
{{He}} detine un MacBook cu un skin custom.
{{He}} poarta un costum Gucci si pantofi asemanatori.
{{He}} is always advising young entrepreneurs to choose a company name that has an emotional hook.
Emailurile {{his}} sunt mereu foarte bine scrise si stabilite clar.
{{He}} often likes to draw diagrams to get a point across.
{{He}} has setup many folders and dozens of rules in {{his}} mailbox.
{{He}} absolutely hates sites that mix up search categories and tags in a confusing way.
{{He}} thinks spreadsheets are one of the most overused and misused tools in the software industry.
{{He}} has helped a number of startups go from an idea to a profitable company.
{{He}} believes the way a product is priced is most important decision an entrepreneur makes.
{{He}} frequently talks about the merits of Lean methodology.
{{He}} discourages early stage startups from building a two-sided marketplace, and instead asks them to focus on building one side first.
{{He}} is a very curious individual who is always on the look-out for a problem worth solving.
{{He}} subscribes to as many podcasts, blogs and magazines on software startup news as {{he}} can find.
{{He}} often says understanding the competition is the most important activity early stage startups should focus on.
{{He}} thinks solving a problem is the easy part. Finding it is what's hard.
{{He}} este cunoscat deoarece face sute de alerte Google.
{{He}} never leaves the house without {{his}} business cards.
{{He}} is very active on social media and has a large following.
{{He}} is known in the industry for some outrageous publicity stunts, including the infamous Banana Leaf incident.
{{He}} often mentions wanting to create a 'win-win' situation.
{{He}} adora sa vorbeasca cu oameni noi si sa ii cunoasca.
{{He}} believes finding the right team is the key to finding success.
{{He}} always asks people for their card or contact information.
{{He}} has a fake LinkedIn account intended only for 'stalking' people.
{{His}} first question to anyone new {{he}} meets is: 'so, what do you do?'
{{He}} was quietly counting the number of chairs in the boardroom.
{{He}} conduce inceputurile {{his}} prin vorba: banii sunt regele.
{{He}} considera ca furnizarea de ceai si cafea gratis angajatilor este o rusine.
{{He}} advises startup founders to take timely payment of employee salaries very seriously.
{{He}} adesea sfatuieste incepatorii sa-si comercializeze brandul cat mai repede.
{{He}} este un mare fan al show-ului Better Call Saul.
{{He}} nu a incercat niciodata sa iasa din datorie.
{{He}} often finishes {{his}} sentences with 'I rest my case'.
Bonus: +1 skill pentru toti actualii si viitorii angajati. Abtitudinea depinde de profilul investitorului.

Getting an investor to invest in your venture is all about getting them excited. Start by examining the investor's profile and showing them slides on topics they might be interested in.

Remember, showing the same type of slide over and over will eventually bore your audience.

When in doubt, you can always ask the investor a clarifying question to eliminate some topics they may not be interested in, at the cost of a slide.

Press the question mark on the computer keyboard to do this.

Well done! You have gauged the interest of this investor and they have put in an offer. Here is your chance to try and get a better deal by reducing the equity, or increasing the investment amount. But remember, if you push the investor too far, they may retract their offer completely!
Din pacate l-ai plictisit pe investitor si nu ti-a mai dat nicio oferta. Mult noroc data viitoare!
Contra oferta dvs. a fost prea agresiva si investitorul a decis sa iasa din afacere. Mult noroc data viitoare!

Three weeks ago, your great uncle {UncleName} passed away after a tragic shoe shopping incident. In his will he left you a sum of $50,000 knowing full well what you would do with it. Distraught, yet excited about the break you have been given, you quit your day job, register the domain {DomainName}, and begin working on your dream startup idea. Here is your story...
You have gone bankrupt! Your uncle rolls in his grave as you burn up the last dollar.

Tired of you living off their retirement savings, your parents {MumName} and {DadName} finally give you an ultimatum: Get a job in 30 days or else. Knowing you could never work for ƒ??the manƒ?, you pool your savings and borrow enough to start your own company: {CompanyName}. ƒ??How hard could it be?ƒ? you think to yourself...
You have gone bankrupt! You take a job at Burgers-R-Us and move back into your parents' basement. Nothing ever changes...

Two days ago you were let go from your job. ƒ??It's not you, it's usƒ? they said. ƒ??Our visions are misalignedƒ? they said. Bogus!!! Amidst your anger you have a moment of clarity. You decide to finally pursue that cool little idea you have had for so long: {CompanyName}. If you are ever going to do it, now is the time. Here is your story...
You have gone bankrupt! You go back to your former employer and beg for your job back. You're given an admin position at half your old salary. Life is grand...

Hi {{FirstName}},

You would have seen your severance documents in an earlier email. I hope there are no hard feelings. I would say that you have contributed so much to our company, that it has been a pleasure working with you all these years, but it hasn't so I won't. I know you have these delusions of grandeur about becoming the next big startup founder. My advice: don't! Go find yourself a job and get on with your life. Then again what do I care!


Your ex-boss,

{{SenderName}}

Hey {{FirstName}},

I just wanted say again that even though this is probably the worst decision you have made in your life, your dad and I fully support you in whatever you are doing. Our door is always open if you decide to come back and stay with us.



Lots of love and kisses,

Mum and dad



P.S. don't forget to drop off your laundry on Saturday.

Dear {{FirstName}},


My name is {{SenderName}}, the executor of your late uncle's will. Per his instructions (and despite the immediate family's many attempts to modify the contents of the will), I have deposited $50,000 to your bank account. I'm glad the matter is now resolved, because frankly I couldn't take any more of it...



Good day to you {{SirOrMadam}},

{{SenderName}}

Knock knock,

My name is Pasithea and I would like to offer you some life changing supplements which I think you have been looking for some time. For a limited time, we are offering our blue pill and red pill collection for half price! The blue pills are fantastic for relaxation, improved sleep, and the closest thing to a cure for insomnia. The red pills will give you that extra boost in the morning and keep you alert all day. 

Typically we would conduct business face to face (that is my son's preferred method), but given the booming nature of this business, email would be the quickest way. Simply reply to this email with the quantity required.


Pasithea


P.S. side effects of the red pill may include vomiting, confusion, increased aggression, fashion change, blindness, and ultimately crucifixion.

Good day,

My name is Ben Dover, attorney of law to the late Princess Charlotte of Wales. I appreciate that the name of Her Royal Highness may be unfamiliar to you; this is because the royal family has, for years, systematically hidden her from the eyes of the public and media due to her unorthodox parentage. Two months ago, when the Princess passed away tragically in a pigeon racing incident (the circumstances of which I still question to this day), she left behind an estate worth two hundred and fifty two million dollars ($252,000,000). This is where I need your help!

As you can appreciate there are those in the royal family who would rather not see this money go to Princess Charlotte's children and wish to bury her legacy along with her. Being the only person working on her behalf, I need your help transferring the full amount to an off-shore account where it can be kept safe. I assure you that my intentions are sincere and that you can trust me. Of course you will also be rewarded for your help. You will just need to follow these simple steps:

1) I will make a full deposit to an account of your choosing.

2) Immediately upon receiving the deposit, you will need to transfer 2 sums to an account which I will provide to you. The first transfer must be for $3.20 and the second for the amount of $7822.32.

3) Shortly thereafter you will receive a package in your mail, from one Pepe Didi. IT IS IMPARATIVE THAT YOU DO NOT OPEN THIS PACKAGE! Please burn it immediately.

4) Over the following three weeks you may notice unusual activity nearby your home, or surrounding streets. Please disregard these and do not be alarmed. Simply ensure your curtains/blinds are closed at all times and stay away from windows whilst at home.

5) At the end of the three weeks transfer 90% of the money ($226,800,000) to the aforementioned account. The remaining $25,200,000 is your reward for helping me with this transaction.


Thank you again, and I trust that you will get back to me very soon.



Yours Sincerely,

Ben Dover

MY DEAR,

I AM HAPPY TO FIND YOUR EMAIL. I AM THE FATHER OF 12 CHILDREN WHO ARE CANADIANS, BUT NOW I LIVE IN JORDAN. I WANT TO MEET SOMEONE LIKE YOU, PERHAPS BECAUSE OF FRIENDSHIP, OR MAYBE SOMEHOW WE MARRY OR NOT, I LOVE TO SEE YOU AND GET THE TIME, PLEASE WRITE TO ME!


JACK

Anonymous
